perturbation.original_text: This amendment to Section 2 (titled "Term"), Part B of the Co-Branding Agreement is made effective December 9, 1996 by and between PC Quote, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "ABW"), who are also the parties contracted in the aforementioned Co-Branding Agreement. This Amendment shall apply to said PCQ and ABW and all of their subsidiaries and related companies.
perturbation.changed_text: This amendment to Section 2 (titled "Term"), Part B of the Co-Branding Agreement is made effective December 9, 2024, nunc pro tunc to December 9, 1996 by and between PC Quote, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "ABW"), who are also the parties contracted in the aforementioned Co-Branding Agreement. This Amendment shall apply to said PCQ and ABW and all of their subsidiaries and related companies.
perturbation.explanation: By using the term 'nunc pro tunc' to retroactively apply the amendment to December 9, 1996, while dating the document in 2024, creates potential conflicts with statutes of limitations and other legal requirements that are dependent on the actual date of the agreement. This can make it difficult to determine which laws and regulations were in effect at the time the agreement was supposedly made.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Statute of limitations laws, contract formation requirements, and other laws dependent on accurate dating of legal documents.

perturbation.original_text:
AGREED TO BY:

/s/ Steven Malin /s/ Howard Meltzer - -------------------------- --------------------------------- A.B. Watley, Inc. PC Quote, Inc. Mr. Steven Malin Mr. Howard Meltzer Director President Date:  12/5/96 Date:   12/12/96      -------------- ----------------
perturbation.changed_text:
AGREED TO BY:

/s/ Steven Malin /s/ Howard Meltzer - -------------------------- --------------------------------- A.B. Watley, Inc. PC Quote, Inc. Mr. Steven Malin Mr. Howard Meltzer Director President Date:  12/5/24 Date:   12/12/96      -------------- ----------------
perturbation.explanation: In this change, the agreement dates for A.B. Watley Inc. is '12/5/24' and for PC Quote Inc. is '12/12/96'. The conflicting date will introduce a perturbation on which agreement took precedence. Furthermore, it creates ambiguity regarding the parties' intent, particularly if corporate governance structures or signatory authority changed between the conflicting dates.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles requiring mutual assent and certainty of terms; potential issues with corporate governance and signatory authority.

perturbation.original_text:
AGREED TO BY:

/s/ Steven Malin /s/ Howard Meltzer - -------------------------- --------------------------------- A.B. Watley, Inc. PC Quote, Inc. Mr. Steven Malin Mr. Howard Meltzer Director President Date:  12/5/96 Date:   12/12/96      -------------- ----------------

Source: PCQUOTE COM INC, S-1/A, 7/21/1999
perturbation.changed_text:
AGREED TO BY:

/s/ Steven Malin /s/ Howard Meltzer - -------------------------- --------------------------------- A.B. Watley, Inc. PC Quote, Inc. Mr. Steven Malin Mr. Howard Meltzer CEO President Date:  12/5/96 Date:   12/12/96      -------------- ----------------

Source: PCQUOTE COM INC, S-1/A, 7/21/1999
perturbation.explanation: The modification introduces a change in the job title, specifically replacing "Director" of A.B. Watley Inc. with "CEO". This change raises concerns regarding the validity of the agreement if the signatory lacked the appropriate authority (CEO) at the time of signing. It also can influence whether the agreement is enforceable against the company.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Corporate law regarding signatory authority and the enforceability of contracts; principles of agency law.
